name: GreyNoise
description: Internet-wide scanner and threat intelligence — IP reputation, mass exploitation detection, and vulnerability intel

tools: ip_lookup — Check IP reputation and classification
ip_context — Full context including tags, CVEs, OS, ports
riot_check — Check if IP belongs to known business service (CDN, cloud, etc.)

setup_steps: 3. Enterprise tier: Full API access, bulk queries, GNQL
4. Get API key from Account Settings → API Key
5. Install: pip install greynoise (or use uvx for MCP)
security_notes: GreyNoise is read-only — no risk of accidental modifications
Community API has rate limits — plan queries accordingly
API key is low-risk (read-only threat intel) but still store securely
GNQL queries can be complex — validate AI-generated queries before trusting results
use_cases: Incident response — is this attacking IP a known mass scanner or targeted?
Alert triage — reduce false positives by filtering known-benign scanners
Threat hunting — find IPs scanning for specific CVEs
Vulnerability prioritisation — is this CVE being actively exploited at scale?
